header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 28 (December 1977)
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Magical Philosophy

central_thesis: The document articulates a core Setian philosophy centered on continuous, conscious, and willful individual evolution ('Xeper'), positing the Temple of Set as the vanguard of this process. It integrates a scientific approach with magical practice to explore psychic phenomena and understand the nature of reality (objective vs. subjective) and post-mortem consciousness.

structure_content.chapter_title: [1] Setward Evolution by Robert Menschel II°
structure_content.summary: This article outlines a pervasive evolutionary process affecting all life, with mankind's evolution primarily mental and social. It positions the Temple of Set as the leading edge of this evolution, uniquely combining scientific rigor with magical exploration to master psychic powers. The author contrasts Setians with psychics, scientists, and traditional magicians, emphasizing the Setian method of systematic study and refinement of magical techniques. The ultimate goal is individual self-evolution (Xeper) towards higher states like Sethood and Daimonhood, acknowledging the inherent dangers and responsibilities of this path.

structure_content.chapter_title: [2] The Subjective Universe and Life After Death by Richard D. Murad II°
structure_content.summary: This article offers a speculative cosmological model distinguishing between objective reality ('God,' the external universe and its laws) and subjective reality (the individual's personal universe, including dreams, fantasies, and the astral plane, where one is 'God'). It posits that upon physical death, an individual's consciousness enters their own subjective astral universe, its nature shaped by their conscious and subconscious mind. The duration of this post-mortem existence is linked to the strength of the individual's will. Magic is proposed as the means to bridge subjective and objective realities, allowing interaction with the external world from the internal.

A personal account illustrating the practical application of 'Xeper' through mundane challenges. The author details experiences of failing to meet the demands of higher-responsibility jobs due to emotional instability and lack of foundational skills. These failures lead to the realization that self-evolution is a process requiring mastery of current levels before advancing. The article concludes with a commitment to consciously step back, 'learn how to sing it' (master basic competencies), and systematically build up the necessary skills for continued growth.

key_concepts.definition: The continuous, multi-directional progression of life, species, society, and individuals. From a Setian perspective, it is a mental, social, and spiritual advancement, with the Temple of Set representing the leading edge, integrating science and magic for occult exploration.

The central Setian concept of self-creation, self-evolution, and becoming. It is a conscious, willful, and ongoing process of individual growth and transformation, aimed at transcending current limitations and achieving higher states of being.

The external universe, its inherent laws, matter, energy, and the relationships therein, existing independently of individual perception. It is characterized as 'God' in the sense of an impersonal, external given.

The individual's personal universe, encompassing dreams, fantasies, and the astral plane. Within this realm, the individual is sovereign ('God') and not bound by the laws of objective reality. It is a completely subjective creation of the mind.

The Setian method of exploring the unknown and interacting with reality. It is characterized as a fusion of scientific rigor (precision, recording, study, improvement) with traditional occult methods to discover, understand, and utilize powers, and potentially to bridge subjective and objective realities.

A philosophical distinction crucial for self-definition within Setianism. The 'I' represents the individual's unique essence and identity, which must be kept separate and distinct from the 'not-I' (everything external or non-self) to strengthen one's conscious will and identity.

practical_system.description: The practical system is primarily one of radical, conscious, and willful individual self-evolution, termed 'Xeper,' rather than a prescriptive ritual system. It is an ongoing, lifelong process of self-creation and mastery. This involves a disciplined, almost scientific, approach to both internal development and external magical exploration. The practitioner is encouraged to systematically explore psychic phenomena, apply rigorous observation and testing to magical workings, and refine methods for optimal results. The system demands constant introspection, learning from experience (including failures), and pushing personal limits to attain higher states of being and mastery over one's subjective reality, and potentially, objective reality.
tools: Conscious Will: The fundamental tool for self-creation, driving Xeper, and for navigating and shaping subjective reality. Its strength determines the persistence and efficacy of one's being.
Intellect and Reason: Utilized for the 'scientific' aspect of magic, including systematic observation, analysis, testing, and understanding underlying principles of both inner and outer realities.
Introspection and Self-Assessment: Essential for identifying areas for personal growth, learning from mistakes, and clearly defining and refining the 'I' in opposition to the 'not-I'.
Experience (Success and Failure): Both are treated as valuable teachers on the evolutionary path, providing data and lessons for continuous improvement and adaptation.
Undisclosed Magical Techniques: Any effective method for exploring the unknown, which is then subjected to rigorous, scientific-like scrutiny and refinement.
rituals: Conscious Willful Evolution (Xeper): Engage in daily, conscious effort to evolve oneself mentally, socially, and spiritually. This involves setting goals, facing challenges, learning from all experiences (successes and failures), and systematically improving personal competencies.

Scientific-Magical Exploration: Apply precision, observation, recording, and testing to magical workings and psychic phenomena. Reduce methods to their 'working minimum,' study their effects, improve upon them, and continually seek new discoveries and uses of personal power. This implies an experimental, non-dogmatic approach to magical practice.

Self-Definition via 'I' and 'Not-I': Practice introspection to clearly distinguish and define one's unique individual essence ('I') from everything external or non-self ('not-I'). This strengthens personal identity and conscious will.

Subjective Reality Cultivation: Engage in practices (like astral projection or deep imaginative work) to actively create, explore, and master one's personal subjective universe, recognizing oneself as sovereign ('God') within it. This also serves as preparation for potential post-mortem existence.

relevant_quotes.text: We follow the dark, blind paths of the magicians, using the bright lights of the scientists. Yes, this works! Reduce it to the working minimum and use it, study it, improve on it, and continue past it to the next discovery, to the next use of our powers.
My goal is not to attain Sethood, not Priesthood, nor even to become Adept. My personal goal is to Xeper, through all the means I can discover, consciously, willfully, to evolve, to Xeper.

What is objective reality? It is “God”. It is the universe [out there] and all the laws which apply therein. It is matter and energy, and all the relationships which apply to either or both. It is not our perceptions of them, but the things in and of themselves.

What it subjective reality? It is our many various and diverse perceptions of "God" in all its aspects. It is also much, much more. It is our dreams and our fantasies. It is our own personal and private universe. “God's laws need not apply in our universe if we so choose. Our universe can be filled with whatever creatures or beings we wish. In it, one day we can be hunters, the next day we can be kings. There are no holes barred. We are supreme in it. In our subjective universe we are “God”, and only we rule.
Perhaps reaching out of our subjective universe and touching objective reality is what magic is all about.
Even when it's your own song, you still have to learn how to sing it.

critical_analysis.relevance: This 'Scroll of Set' issue is crucial for understanding the foundational Setian philosophy of individual self-evolution (Xeper) and its unique approach to magic. It articulates an early Setian cosmology distinguishing objective and subjective realities, with speculation on post-mortem existence as an immersion in a personalized subjective universe. The integration of scientific methodology into magical practice is a key innovation, positioning Setianism as a rational, results-oriented magical tradition. The document also provides practical examples of Xeper's application in everyday life, grounding abstract philosophical concepts in personal development. Its ideas on subjective reality and the magician's sovereignty within it prefigure elements found in later Chaos Magic discourse, though within a distinct Gnostic-leaning Setian framework.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is existing initiates and prospective members of the Temple of Set. The text assumes familiarity with internal terminology (e.g., 'Elect,' 'Sethood,' 'Daimon') and references specific individuals and prior 'Scroll' issues. It serves to deepen understanding of Setian philosophy, reinforce core tenets like Xeper, and guide adherents in their personal and magical evolution within the Temple's framework.
